events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and a tree resulting in moderate damage.
The claim was categorized under auto accident after review of the initial report and damage description.
An agent specialized in vehicle accidents has been assigned to handle the claim and contact the customer.
Customer was notified that their claim has been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
The insurance company requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all required documents, including police report and detailed repair quotes.
The investigation into the accident circumstances began to verify the claim details and liability.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of claim validity and no suspicious discrepancies found.
Based on the investigation, a settlement amount was proposed to cover repair and associated costs.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the process.
The claim was officially approved for the settlement amount proposed after customer agreement.
Settlement payment was issued to the customer promptly to cover vehicle repair costs.
The claim file was closed after all procedures completed and payment successfully issued.
All claim information was archived for records and future reference according to company policy.
